examples: I tried a new coffee blend with hints of chocolate and caramel.
Try some dried apricots as a healthy snack.
Give sweetsop a try!
Have you tried this new coffee?
The case was tried before a jury.
words.defineEn: an effort to achieve or do something
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực để đạt được hoặc làm một cái gì đó

examples: The prisoner attempted to break away from the guards during the chaos.
It attempts to read a floppy disk without regard to its format.
He made no attempt to apologize.
She was attempting to raise $20,000.
The company has attempted to break the strike using non-union labor.
words.defineEn: to try to complete or do something difficult
words.defineVi: để cố gắng hoàn thành hoặc làm một cái gì đó khó khăn

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
College tuitions cost an arm and leg nowadays.
Estimates put the war's cost at £1 million a day.
It will cost $1,500 to get the car back on the road.
The trip to the beach cost me $100, but I almost broke even after winning $90 in a contest.
words.defineEn: to cause the loss of something, often valuable
words.defineVi: để gây ra sự mất mát của một cái gì đó, thường có giá trị

examples: Extreme solutions to problems always lead to difficulties.
I was having difficulty in staying awake.
The company ran into financial difficulties and had to lay off employees.
He has difficulty in following written instructions.
I'm not afraid of difficulties or obstacles, bring it on!
words.defineEn: a problem or something that causes a problem
words.defineVi: một vấn đề hoặc một cái gì đó gây ra một vấn đề

examples: Many schools don’t take full advantage of the Internet.
To take advantage of this extra bonus offer, simply check the box on your order form.
The entrepreneur knew that time and tide wait for no man, so she took advantage of every opportunity to grow her business.
She has a weakness for polite men, use that to your advantage.
The coach had to leave practice early, and the players took advantage of the situation by goofing off and not taking the drills seriously.
words.defineEn: a condition that causes a person or thing to be more successful compared to others
words.defineVi: một điều kiện khiến một người hoặc một vật thành công hơn so với những người khác

examples: This approach had several disadvantages.
But for many developers, the disadvantages outweighed any potential upside.
Rural hospitals are at a disadvantage.
And women have been disadvantaged ever since.
This guy is already at a disadvantage.
words.defineEn: a situation that has fewer or no benefits over another, which makes succeeding difficult
words.defineVi: một tình huống có ít hoặc không có lợi ích hơn một tình huống khác, khiến cho việc thành công trở nên khó khăn

examples: It's true that reality is disappointing.
She used the wrong ingredients in the recipe, resulting in a disappointing dish.
But then the wheels came off the bus in the final season, and now it's often derided as one of the most disappointing finales of all time.
After receiving the disappointing news, John's face turned dark and he had a face like thunder for the rest of the day.
And the speakers are pretty disappointing as well.
words.defineEn: not fulfilling expectations
words.defineVi: không đáp ứng mong đợi

examples: He had high expectations for the team's performance in the tournament.
The annual yield of the wheat fields surpassed expectations, resulting in a plentiful harvest.
The girl's simple words had been ringing the death-knell of his expectations.
I was living in cloud-cuckoo-land about my salary expectations.
The real estate investment provided a high yield, exceeding the initial expectations of the investors.
words.defineEn: a belief about something that will come to pass, because it is probable
words.defineVi: một niềm tin về một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra, bởi vì nó có thể xảy ra

examples: The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
A fire attack shall chill the enemy to the bone.
The enemy was driven back.
The weakness of the enemy makes our strength.
They were working hand in glove with our enemies.
words.defineEn: someone who is against a person, or hates them
words.defineVi: một người chống lại một người, hoặc ghét họ

examples: The project failed for the want of adequate funding.
Words are failing me right now.
Her date failed to show.
The rise in turnover failed to add to the company's bottom line.
Politicians again failed to reach an agreement.
words.defineEn: to be unsuccessful in accomplishing something
words.defineVi: không thành công trong việc hoàn thành một cái gì đó

examples: Failure was staring him in the face.
This business method takes the risk of failure out of the table.
Success has many fathers, failure is an orphan, indeed.
The boss whaled on us for the entirety of the meeting because of our failure to meet our sales quota.
The woman planted a seed of failure in Michelle Obama before she could even try to succeed.
words.defineEn: the absence of success in achieving a goal
words.defineVi: sự vắng mặt của thành công trong việc đạt được một mục tiêu

examples: but then we hit trouble.
Are you causing trouble again?
There was trouble on hand.
I have trouble hearing you.
We had trouble starting the car.
words.defineEn: the fact or situation of causing a difficulty
words.defineVi: thực tế hoặc tình huống gây khó khăn

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: with a lot of difficulty or effort
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều khó khăn hoặc nỗ lực

examples: The lost child was helped by a kind police officer to find their way home.
The hikers diligently searched the dense forest for the lost trail, using a map and compass as their guide.
Whenever I feel lost or uncertain, I turn to my favorite books, knowing that a book holds a house of gold that can provide guidance and inspiration.
And on Wall Street today, stocks made up some lost ground.
It's a lost cause.
words.defineEn: describing something that is gone or does not exist anymore
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó đã biến mất hoặc không tồn tại nữa

examples: He never missed a televised basketball or football game.
I missed the part where that's my problem.
but we missed them.
She received a missed call from an unknown phone number.
You've missed your mark three times in a row.
words.defineEn: to lose the chance to experience or have something
words.defineVi: để mất cơ hội để trải nghiệm hoặc có một cái gì đó

examples: The policeman pinched his eyes as if overcome with a sudden stab of pain.
The determined athlete carried the day, overcoming adversity and winning the race with a strong finish.
When the company's financial problems became too severe to overcome, the CEO called in a financial consultant for advice.
Mary gets a frog in her throat whenever she has to sing in front of an audience, but she practices diligently to overcome it.
The scientist understood that every bean has its black, and that even the most promising hypothesis may have flaws that need to be addressed and overcome.
words.defineEn: to succeed in solving, controlling, or dealing with something difficult
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc giải quyết, kiểm soát, hoặc đối phó với một cái gì đó khó khăn

examples: A large cardboard box will serve the purpose.
These experiments serve no useful purpose.
The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
The revised edition is to all intents and purposes a new book.
The main purpose of industry is to create wealth.
words.defineEn: a desired outcome that guides one's plans or actions
words.defineVi: một kết quả mong muốn hướng dẫn các kế hoạch hoặc hành động của một người

examples: She achieved great success at a young age.
She had already achieved success beyond her wildest dreams.
The tennis player achieved a clean sweep of her matches, winning every set and advancing to the finals.
He achieved success by ruthlessly running roughshod over anyone who got in his way.
Some vegan cheeses use algae-based ingredients to achieve a creamy texture and unique flavor.
words.defineEn: to finally get the desired goal after dealing with many difficulties
words.defineVi: để cuối cùng có được mục tiêu mong muốn sau khi đối phó với nhiều khó khăn

examples: The attack was unsuccessful and served only to alert the enemy.
After several unsuccessful attempts to start my own business, I decided that if you cannot beat them, join them and accepted a job offer from a successful startup.
And they have, for the most part, been unsuccessful.
But she declines these offers because her own home search has been unsuccessful.
The move was intended to open doors to federal funding for the fire survivors, but it was unsuccessful.
words.defineEn: showing failure at achieving what you intended to
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự thất bại trong việc đạt được những gì bạn dự định

examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: to make efforts in order to obtain or achieve something
words.defineVi: để nỗ lực để có được hoặc đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: The couple faced many obstacles, but they never lost hope because they believed that hope is a lover's staff.
I'm not afraid of difficulties or obstacles, bring it on!
The experienced hiker knew the trail well and was always one jump ahead, anticipating obstacles and finding the best path forward.
We will stand by you through thick and thin, no matter the challenges or obstacles that come our way.

The scientist faced numerous challenges and obstacles in his research, but remembered that a handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains, and persisted with determination and hard work until he finally made groundbreaking discoveries.
words.defineEn: a situation or problem that prevents one from succeeding
words.defineVi: một tình huống hoặc vấn đề ngăn cản một người thành công

examples: Life goes on.
This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
The show must go on!
My family goes on a vacation once a year.
Shares went on sale this morning.
words.defineEn: to continue without stopping
words.defineVi: tiếp tục mà không dừng lại

examples: The old man gave up the ghost.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Er, don't give up the day job!
We gave up the right to use the valley.
words.defineEn: to stop trying when faced with failures or difficulties
words.defineVi: ngừng cố gắng khi đối mặt với thất bại hoặc khó khăn

examples: The company abandoned its outdated marketing strategy in favor of a more innovative approach.
After careful consideration, he abandoned his previous beliefs and embraced a new ideology.
She abandoned her car on the side of the road and walked home.
The ship was abandoned by its crew after it started taking on water.
The government decided to abandon the proposed legislation due to public opposition.
words.defineEn: to completely give up
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn từ bỏ

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Fighting like cats and dogs like always.
The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
He has always fought the good fight against oppression.
A young cyclist is fighting for his life after the accident.
words.defineEn: to make a strong and continuous effort to achieve something
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một nỗ lực mạnh mẽ và liên tục để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: I've already accomplished several things on my bucket list, but there's still more to do.
He focused on the meat and potatoes of his job, accomplishing tasks efficiently and effectively.
By this time next year, we will have stood fast and accomplished our goals.
Stepping into the shoes of your master is not an easy task to accomplish.
Sarah is getting on for 40, and she's already accomplished so much in her career.
words.defineEn: to successfully finish doing something after experiencing difficulties
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành thành công làm một cái gì đó sau khi gặp khó khăn

examples: His dedication and hard work played a big part in the company's success.
She achieved great success at a young age.
The team's success is built on the meat and potatoes of hard work and dedication.
The success of the project is in your hands.
Success has many fathers, failure is an orphan, indeed.
words.defineEn: the fact of reaching or achieving what one tried for or desired
words.defineVi: thực tế đạt được hoặc đạt được những gì một người đã cố gắng hoặc mong muốn

examples: The rebels succeeded in taking the town.
The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
Opponents have succeeded in planting the seeds of doubt in our team.
In the end, she succeeded because nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
Without a good plan, our project doesn't stand a chance of succeeding.
words.defineEn: to reach or achieve what one desired or tried for
words.defineVi: để đạt được hoặc đạt được những gì một mong muốn hoặc cố gắng cho

words.defineEn: (of a job or occupation) providing a high salary or income in comparison to others in the same industry or field
words.defineVi: (của một công việc hoặc nghề nghiệp) mang lại mức lương hoặc thu nhập cao so với những người khác trong cùng ngành hoặc lĩnh vực

examples: but then we hit trouble.
Are you causing trouble again?
There was trouble on hand.
I have trouble hearing you.
We had trouble starting the car.
words.defineEn: to cause problems for someone
words.defineVi: để gây ra vấn đề cho một ai đó

examples: That one mistake left him thousands of pounds out of pocket.
One mistake and we're back to the drawing board.
He put salt into the sugar bowl by mistake.
The athlete's mistakes during the game put him on the firing line of criticism from fans and media.
The teacher corrected my mistake and explained the correct solution.
words.defineEn: an act or opinion that is wrong
words.defineVi: một hành động hoặc ý kiến đó là sai
